articles.title: DPRK High-level Delegation Meets S. Korean President
articles.content:
DPRK High-level Delegation Meets S. Korean President
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK high-level delegation led by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met with south Korean President Moon Jae In at Chongwadae on Saturday after attending the opening ceremony of the 23rd Winter Olympics.
					 Moon Jae In warmly greeted the DPRK delegation at the main lobby of Chongwadae, exchanging greetings with it, and had photo sessions with Kim Yong Nam and Kim Yo Jong respectively.
					
					 Then Kim Yong Nam and Kim Yo Jong had a warm talk with Moon Jae In on the first floor of Chongwadae.
					
					 Moon Jae In said at the talk that the current visit of the delegation of the north side created a spark of improving the inter-Korean relations and ensuring peace on the Korean peninsula and that he extends his heartfelt thanks to Chairman Kim Jong Un for providing today's significant occasion.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam congratulated Moon Jae In on the successful opening of the Winter Olympics and expressed gratitude to him for sitting together with them while dealing with a great event.
					
					 At the talk, Kim Yo Jong, first vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, upon authorization of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Party, state and army of the DPRK, courteously handed over his personal letter to President Moon Jae In and verbally conveyed his intention.
					
					 President Moon Jae In expressed deep thanks to Chairman Kim Jong Un for taking a special step of making the high-level delegation of the north side participate in the Olympics and sending his personal letter and verbal greetings, and asked for certainly conveying his gratitude to Chairman Kim Jong Un.
					
					 After delivery of the personal letter, the DPRK delegation had a frank and candid talk with the south side over the issue of improving the north-south relations.
					
					 President Moon Jae In expressed the will to take one step after another for the common prosperity of the south and the north in close cooperation with each other, saying that the inter-Korean relations should be mended by the parties concerned at any cost as indicated by Chairman Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam said that even unexpected difficulties and ordeals could be surely overcome and the future of reunification brought earlier when having a firm will and taking courage and determination to usher in a new heyday of inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The talk proceeded in a sincere and cordial atmosphere.
					
					 Present there were Choe Hwi, chairman of the National Sports Guidance Committee, Ri Son Gwon, chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country, and Im Jong Sok, presidential chief of staff of Chongwadae, Jong Ui Yong, chief of the State Security Office, Jo Myong Gyun, minister of Unification, and So Hun, director of the National Intelligence Service.
					
					 On the same day Moon Jae In hosted a luncheon at Chongwadae in honor of the DPRK delegation.
					
					 Present there were all members of the DPRK delegation and participants of the south side in the talk and leading persons concerned at the National Intelligence Service and the State Security Office.
					
					 A welcoming address was made at the luncheon which proceeded in a cordial atmosphere.
					
					 At the end of the luncheon, there was a photo session with all members of the DPRK high-level delegation at Moon Jae In's request.
					
					 That day Kim Yong Nam and Kim Yo Jong made entries in the visitor's book of Chongwadae.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Watches Women's Ice Hockey Match with S. Korean President
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Watches Women's Ice Hockey Match with S. Korean President
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK high-level delegation led by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Saturday watched together with south Korean President Moon Jae In and his wife a women's ice hockey match between the unified team of the north and the south of Korea and the Swiss team in the 23rd Winter Olympics.
					 Present to watch the match were the DPRK National Olympic Committee delegation and Swiss President Alain Berset, President of the IOC Thomas Bach and other foreign guests, sports fans and south Koreans.
					
					 The cheering group of the north and the south and south Koreans burst into warm applause and cheers while waving flags of the Korean peninsula to inspire the players of the unified team skillfully driving the puck, calling each other by the same language and pooling efforts.
					
					 The appearance of the players and the impressive picture of the cheering groups once again made the spectators feel keenly that the Korean nation is a homogeneous nation which can't live separated from each other.
					
					 At the end of the match, Kim Yong Nam and Kim Yo Jong met and encouraged the players of the unified team together with Moon Jae In and had a photo session with them.

articles.title: Joint Taekwon-Do Demonstration Performance of North and South of Korea
articles.content:
Joint Taekwon-Do Demonstration Performance of North and South of Korea
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Taekwon-Doists from the north and the south of Korea gave a joint demonstration performance in Sokcho of south Korea on Saturday.
					 Watching the performance were the president of the ITF, leading members of the IOC, personages of various strata from the south side and Taekwon-Do fans.
					
					 Members of the DPRK Taekwon-Do demonstration group, who have displayed the might of Taekwon-Do, pride of the nation, on the global stages, gave full play to the mental and physical ability of the Korean nation, resourceful and brave, and the development of Taekwon-Do technique put on a high stage.
					
					 The spectators broke into warm cheers and applause when the members of the group showcased strong mettle of the nation, flawlessly performing accuracy, unanimity, speed, power, balance, rhythm and other details.
					
					 Taekwon-Doists from the south side also displayed their excellent technique.
					
					 Whenever the Taekwon-Doists from the north and the south of Korea perfectly performed together the original and diverse techniques of the orthodox martial art of the nation, the spectators were unsparing in applause.
					
					 The joint demonstration performance served as an occasion of powerfully demonstrating at home and abroad the mettle and bravery of the Korean nation as it was held amid great expectations and interest of all compatriots aspiring after national reconciliation and unity.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the United Socialist Nationalist Party of Nepal headed by Chairman of its Central Committee Kamal Prasad Chaulagain and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 The visitors paid high tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 They paid homage to the great leaders who lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their life.

articles.title: Minju Joson on Japan Police Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon
articles.content:
Minju Joson on Japan Police Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the Japan police authorities hurled more than 100 armed policemen in broad daylight to search the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and the house of a Chongryon official and the "Mirae Foundation" set up for rendering support for the Korean school. Earlier to this, they walked off the former official of Chongryon without any clear evidence, on charges of "violation of the law on secondhand dealers".
					 Commenting on the fact, Minju Joson Sunday says:
					
					 What matters is that the Japan police authorities justify their present anti-Chongryon suppression campaign under the unreasonable pretext of a "record of remitting money".
					
					 It is the height of obstinacy and far-fetchedness.
					
					 The said record of banknote is the record made by its owner when remitting the cost of publications including Choson Sinbo to the official in charge of publicity and culture work of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon in the days when he was working as an official of a branch of Chongryon. So it has no relation with the "violation of the law on secondhand dealers".
					
					 What increases the suspicion and denunciation at home and abroad, however, is the act of the Japan police authorities which conducted once again such farce of little worth after three months since they ransacked every nook and corner of the house of the former chairman of the Katsushika branch of Chongryon on charges of the "violation of the law on secondhand dealers" in October last year.
					
					 Lurking behind this is a crafty and sordid political attempt peculiar to the island country.
					
					 It is so clear that its aim is to charge Chongryon, a dignified overseas citizens' organization of the DPRK, as an "illegal organization" and "lawless body", stoke atmosphere against the DPRK and Chongryon throughout Japan, escalate the tension on the Korean peninsula with it as an occasion and thus pave the way for realizing Japan's dirty militarist ambition.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns U.S. against "Bloody Nose Operation"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns U.S. against "Bloody Nose Operation"
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the members of the National Security Council of the White House said at a closed meeting of U.S. experts on the Korean peninsula affairs that Trump is seriously discussing the "bloody nose operation" and the limited attack on the DPRK will help Trump's off-year election. This created quite a stir after its disclosure to the public.
					 Against this background, domestic and foreign media, relating the "operation" to the facts that the appointment of a person informally designated as the U.S. ambassador to south Korea was withdrawn for his rejection of Trump's tough military plan and that the nuclear strategic assets and special units of the U.S. are being massively deployed in and around Korean peninsula, estimated that a military conflict may break out on the Korean peninsula in late March or early April after the Winter Olympics.
					
					 In this regard, Rodong Sinmun in a commentary Sunday says that the practical moves of the Trump clan for the realization of the "bloody nose operation" are an intentional provocation aimed to destroy the peaceful atmosphere on the Korean peninsula created by the initiative measures and efforts of the DPRK and turn the present situation back into confrontation and war.
					
					 It is the invariable intention of the U.S. to realize its strategy for domination over Asia-Pacific while keeping the situation of the Korean peninsula constantly tense, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is for this reason that the U.S. is trying to put a brake to the present current of improving north-south relations and lead the situation to the escalation of tension, being unhappy about the detente on Korean peninsula.
					
					 But the DPRK will not give up its option, being frightened by the threat and blackmail of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. should stop acting rashly, mindful that it will face unimaginable tragic consequences if it provokes the DPRK through so-called "bloody nose operation".

articles.title: U.S. and Japan's Racket for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula Blasted
articles.content:
U.S. and Japan's Racket for Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula Blasted
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Now heard nonstop from the U.S. political camp and military are such provocative rhetoric that "war scenario with the DPRK is in place" and "they are ready to fight even tonight".
					 The prime minister, foreign minister and defense minister of Japan are responding to it with such balderdash as "threat" from the DPRK, while saying that "the DPRK is employing the strategy of whiling away time" and urging the need "not to be taken in by the smile diplomacy but to put maximum pressure with all possible means".
					
					 It is against this backdrop that the formation of U.S. nuclear strategic bombers and formations of F-15 fighters of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" including B-52 deployed in Guam under the pretext of rotational deployment went frantic in conducting joint aerial exercises.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday condemns it as a hysteric act quite contrary to the desire of the international community, an act which is not compatible with the prevailing environment on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. and Japan seek tensions and war, not stability and peace on the Korean peninsula, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 The atmosphere for detente being created on the Korean peninsula can not be welcomed by the U.S. which aims at realizing its Asia-Pacific domination strategy by keeping south Korea as a springboard for invasion of the DPRK and the continent and at gaining profits from munitions dealings, nor by Japan which seeks the ambition for reinvasion with the backing of the master.
					
					 Herein lies the reason that the U.S. and Japan are stoking the confrontation with the DPRK in order to undermine the atmosphere for detente.
					
					 The U.S. and Japan will only face worldwide censure as a chief culprit harassing peace no matter how persistently they may cry out for confrontation with the DPRK while going against the trend of the times, and such acts will only harden the will of the Korean people to retaliate against the sworn enemies.

articles.title: S. Koreans Blast U.S., Japan and Conservatives
articles.content:
S. Koreans Blast U.S., Japan and Conservatives
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Various strata of south Korea have reportedly condemned the U.S., Japan and the south Korean conservative forces for trying to check the trend of improved inter-Korean relations and inflame confrontation and war crisis.
					 The internet paper minplusnews on Feb. 9 editorially urged the U.S. and Japan to stop their acts of stoking confrontation and antagonism and the evil forces inciting division to properly face up to the trend of the times.
					
					 The Kyongnam Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration made public a statement denouncing the U.S. for chilling the efforts for improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The chairman of the South Kyongsang Provincial Committee of the People's Party in a press conference on Feb. 8 flailed the U.S. vice-president for hindering the improvement of the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 Jong Se Hyon, former minister of Unification, in a radio show criticized the chief executive of Japan for urging the resumption of south Korea-U.S. joint military exercises.
					
					 Meanwhile, lawmakers from the ruling Minju Party rejected Japan's intervention.

articles.title: Bird Flu Occurs in South Chungchong Province of S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Occurs in South Chungchong Province of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A bird flu was reported in Chonan City, South Chungchong Province of south Korea on February 8, according to the KBS of south Korea.
					 H5N6 type bird flu virus was detected as a result of the examination of ailing chickens in a chicken farm in the city.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Posted on Website of Nigerian Body
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Posted on Website of Nigerian Body
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee of the People's Progressive Party of Nigeria for celebrating the 76th birth anniversary of HE Generalissimo Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) posted on its website the brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il on Jan. 30 on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Birthdays of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Birthdays of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on Feb. 5 formed a preparatory committee to celebrate the 106th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 First Secretary Alexandr Gromov was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee set a celebration period from Feb. 5 to April 16 and decided to hold colorful political and cultural events such as seminar and film show in praise of the great revolutionary careers and undying feats of the great leaders in the period.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Spain
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Spain
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A Spanish preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on Jan. 30.
					 Victor Manuel Lucas, international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the People of Spain, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold various political and cultural events such as seminar and film show in praise of the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Will Shine Forever: Indonesian Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Will Shine Forever: Indonesian Figure
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Ristiyanto, general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, on Jan. 30 made public a statement ahead of the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Noting that with his original Songun politics Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a politico-military power which no formidable enemy can invade, and devoted his all to the happiness of the people till the last moments of his life, the statement said:
					
					 He made a great contribution to the development of the friendly ties between Indonesia and the DPRK and to the global peace and security.
					
					 His exploits for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence will shine forever.
					
					 Today the DPRK is demonstrating its prestige as a military power with a tremendous war deterrent under the guidance of HE Kim Jong Un who has carried forward the cause of HE 
					
					Kim Jong Il as it is.
					
					 Under the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un the Korean people will surely build a powerful socialist country in the near future.

articles.title: Delegacion de ato nivel de la RPDC se reune con presidente surcoreano en Chongwadae
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Moon Jae In
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y jefe de la delegacion de alto nivel de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se reunio el dia 9 con el presidente surcoreano Moon Jae In en el acto de bienvenida efectuado en visperas de la ceremonia inaugural de los XXIII Juegos Olimpicos Invernales.
					  KIm Yong Nam y Moon Jae In intercambiaron el saludo cordial y se fotografiaron.
					
					  Y en el mismo lugar el presidente de la APS de la RPDC saludo con los jefes de Estado y gobierno de varios paises que vinieron a participar en la ceremonia inaugural de estos juegos.

articles.title: Delegacion de alto nivel presencia con Moon Jae In el juego de equipo unico (f) de hockey
articles.content:
Inaugurados los XXIII Juegos Olimpicos Invernales
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedaron inaugurados en Phyongchang del Sur de Corea los XXIII Juegos Olimpicos Invernales.
					  La ceremonia inaugural tuvo lugar el dia 9 en el estadio olimpico de Phyongchang.
					
					  Tomaron asientos en la tribuna Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y jefe de la delegacion de alto nivel de la RPDC, y Kim Yo Jong, primera subjefa de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los miembros de la delegacion de alto nivel, la del Comite Olimpico Nacional, el grupo artistico y el de hinchas, de la RPDC, asi como el de hinchas de coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					  Participaron el presidente Moon Jae In y las personalidades de los circulos politicos y sociales del Sur de Corea, el presidente del Comite Olimpico Internacional Thomas Bach, los jefes de Estado y de gobierno de varios paises del mundo, los huespedes extranjeros y los aficionados al deporte.
					
					Entraron los jugadores y otras personas de varios paises y regiones participantes en la Olimpiada.
					
					  En medio de la interpretacion de la cancion coreana "Arirang", los jugadores del Norte y el Sur de Corea con la bandera de reunificacion al frente de la fila entraron en la sede de la ceremonia inaugural.
					
					  Kim Yong Nam, Kim Yo Jong y el matrimonio del presidente Moon Jae In enviaron saludos agitandoles las manos.
					
					  Los participantes en el acto estimularon a los jugadores coreanos del Norte y el Sur que marchan juntos bajo la bandera de reunificacion con el mapa de Corea.
					
					  Los presidentes del comite organizador del presente festival deportivo y del Comite Olimpico Internacional pronunciaron discursos de felicitacion y el presidente surcoreano Moon Jae In anuncio la inauguracion.
					
					  Mientras se interpreta la cancion olimpica, se izo la bandera olimpica y se realizo el juramento.
					
					  Seguidamente, se efectuo la ceremonia de encendimiento de la antorcha.
					
					  Con anterioridad al acto inaugural, se realizo la demostracion modelo de los taekwondocas del Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					  Este dia, Kim Yo Jong, primera subjefa de departamento del CC del PTC, apreto la mano e intercambio los saludos cordiales con el presidente Moon Jae In y su esposa.
					
					  Los Juegos Olimpicos se clausuraran el dia 25.

articles.title: Se realiza la demostracion modelo conjunta de taekwondocas del Norte y el Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Extranjeros se reunen en actos de festejo de natalicio de Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tuvieron lugar del 20 al 26 de enero los actos de festejo en Polonia, Ucrania y Espana.
					  En las ocasiones participaron las personalidades de diversos sectores y los habitantes de los respectivos paises.
					
					  Las personalidades polacas dijeron que Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il es el dirigente extraordinario que ofrendo todo lo suyo por la prosperidad del pais y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					Agregaron que gracias a la solida base sentada por el, la RPDC pudo dar grandes saltos frustrando los desafios de toda indole de las fuerzas hostiles con su invencible poderio militar.
					
					  El presidente de la Asociacion de Estudio de la Idea Juche en Lvov de Ucrania senalo que el Dirigente practico la original politica de Songun en el tiempo mas dificil de la revolucion coreana permitiendo al pueblo coreano crear los milagros e innovaciones sorprendentes. Continuo que brillara en la historia moderna de Corea el nombre del gran hombre sin par.
					
					  En el acto efectuado en Espana, los oradores elogiaron que toda la vida del lider coreano se caracteriza por la dedicacion a la patria y al pueblo y por la obligacion moral internacionalista con que el ayudo material y espiritualmente a los paises y pueblos aspirantes a la independencia.
